TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content:
KSP 1.10.1 / Spectra-1.4.0 / scatterer-0.0621c / EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements-1.9.0.3 (R-T-B)

bug repeated ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

Spoiler

> 
> 
> 17 hours ago, R-T-B said:
> 
> 
> Could you guys try with the old Environmental Visual Enhancements build, before I used BIOZ's shader recompile?
> 

I just did;  the bug is still there, and the rings are buggy as well: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/wp3f4wz71xs8ysf/Buggy atmosphere 3.PNG?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/wp3f4wz71xs8ysf/Buggy%20atmosphere%203.PNG?dl=0)

Log: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/221v8oprmj60sm0/Player.log?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/221v8oprmj60sm0/Player.log?dl=0)

Could the problem be with RVE64k?

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, Entropian said:
> 
> 
> Could the problem be with RVE64k?
> 

I don't know, but thank you for confirming the bug is not with me so I can restore my build.  I was worried and I do appreciate you at least testing for me.

Try without RVE64k maybe?  Only thing I can think to do in your position to rule it out.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, R-T-B said:
> 
> 
> Try without RVE64k maybe?
> 

Ok, I just tested without RVE64k and it went away.  I'm about to test with RSSVE and see if it still appears.

EDIT: It was RVE64k!  I installed RSSVE and the white atmosphere was replaced with the enhanced ones from RSSVE.  I'm going to take this to the RVE64k thread now.  Thanks for helping narrow down this bug [@R-T-B](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/200868-r-t-b/) and [@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/)!

**Edited <time datetime="2020-08-17T20:43:51Z" title="08/17/2020 08:43  PM" data-short="3 yr">August 17, 2020</time> by Entropian**

Hello, I am currently experiencing a bug which hinders gameplay. And I know scatterer is the culprit because the bug involves one of its features. Whenever I have the ocean shaders on, the ocean instead disappears completely. This hinders gameplay because I cannot see the ocean so if I am launching a boat or landing in it, I don't know how far away it is. This also applies to regular gameplay so I know its not just a thing in the menu![hzP5VEd.png](https://i.imgur.com/hzP5VEd.png)![Hfh8kfX.png](https://i.imgur.com/Hfh8kfX.png)![VXNs7mS.png](https://i.imgur.com/VXNs7mS.png)![JJzXhzZ.png](https://i.imgur.com/JJzXhzZ.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2020-08-20T00:39:12Z" title="08/20/2020 12:39  AM" data-short="3 yr">August 20, 2020</time> by Nebulagoodies**

Ok, here is a comparison between;  

Scatterer, v0.0621 Plus an old version of <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> (Using SVE Configs, with the scatterer configs deleted)

vs

Scatterer v0.0630. Plus Blackrack's "performance-enhanced" version of <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> (Using SVE Configs, with the scatterer configs deleted)

Computer;

Core I7 7700k @ 5.05 GHz (custom water cooling loop with 1 x Black Ice Nemesis 280GTS rad, and 1 x Bitspower Leviathan SF 240 rad)

32Gb DDR4 3200 14-14-14-34 XMP enabled. 

EVGA GeForce RTX 2080 SUPER FTW3 HYDRO COPPER (water cooled of course)

Mods... or at least most of them besides Scatterer, Eve and SVE...  

ModuleManager  

ClickThroughBlocker  

FilterExtensions  

Toolbar  

BAM  

BDArmory  

CameraTools  

DestructionEffects  

EditorExtensionsRedux  

Firespitter  

KerbalEngineer  

KSP-AVC  

PhysicsRangeExtender  

ShowFPS v0.2.3.0  

SmartParts  

TextureReplacer  

VesselMover

<iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="270" width="480" data-embed-src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/qQ5vdQ0Y-Zw?feature=oembed"></iframe>

I personally like the color of the water better in the old Scatterer, but that is nit picking... All in all, there seems to be a very slight performance increase with the new Eve, but for me, only about 5 or 6 FPS. This may be much more pronounced on a lower end system.

This maybe should have been put in the new <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> thread....

Scatterer 0.0630 seems to work great! No more night voids at <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr>, craft in orbit look bright as they ought to.

I have not installed the new <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> however. (I'm using the current <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> and configs from WazWaz's github (1.8.0-2), as well as Planetshine 0.2.6.1. Also EngineLightingRelit (1.6.2.3 with Smokescreen))

But, it looks great on my end.

ok, ill make a new log. thank you a lot!

[@Not a Spy](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/205528-not-a-spy/) There are at least 3 obvious problems with your install:

1: These folders are supposed to be inside WildBlueIndustries/ ...

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> 000ABARISBridgeDoNotDelete  
> 
> 000WildBlueTools  
> 
> 001KerbalActuators  
> 
> ClassicStockResources  
> 
> Heisenberg
> 

2: You have more than one version of the <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> dll. Only have the latest version present. Delete the others.

3: You have a GameData folder in your GameData folder. That's a huge no. (Scatterer might be in there, with whatever else.)

Problems aside, JSI is involved with RasterPropMonitor. It shouldn't be terribly important unless you're really concerned with IVAs and whatever parts are packaged in it.

> 2 hours ago, Not a Spy said:

> i only see one modulule manager

Indeed. The new log you linked does not contain that particular problem... The other issues JadeOfMaar pointed out are still present though, including a nested GameData and a bunch of mod directories in the wrong place.  

Scatterer has even noticed how messed up your install is:  

    [Scatterer][Error] Destroying duplicate instance, check your install for duplicate mod folders

Presumably that means there's another copy in GameData/GameData (which shouldn't exist to begin with), along with who knows what else. Chaos ensues.

Trying to troubleshoot supposed scatterer bugs in amongst this disaster is pretty pointless. You have errors from several other mods, as well as from stock game code - the latter is almost certainly caused by the former, and either could be breaking scatterer.  

I recommend a fresh install, with mods managed by <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> so you don't get into such a mess again.  

Once you have the rest of your house in order, of if you can reproduce the problem with only scatterer, then we'll talk scatterer bugs.
